data.title: Yummy Peanuts
data.text: I was there after attending an event at the civic Theater. I purchased some cashews and they were well worth the money!

data.title: A Wonderful Surprise in downtown Akron
data.text: I prepared for a trip to Akron by reading reviews in Trip Advisor. This shop rated well. My hosts had never been here but had often driven passed the original store, now empty, across the street. The aroma of roasted nuts and the visual scanning of varieties of raw nuts, candies, dark chocolate covered nuts, and much more in the long cases felt satisfying. I knew I'd bring home bags of goodies! The owner explained the family history of the shop and showed us the old photos on the wall. She described the roasting process and the aroma.  People line up to buy these treats before concerts across the street in Lock 3 or before holidays or call to have the foods shipped. We saw the famous Planters Peanut costume from 1939 that is still worn in town parades! We tasted samples, bought plenty, and felt we had made friends.

data.title: Nostalgic and charming in downtown Akron
data.text: Worth a stop if you are in downtown Akron.   Great throw-back atmosphere and the peanuts are great! Near the Civic Theatre.

data.title: Great little place
data.text:
The peanut shoppe is a must see if you are in down town Akron. It's a tiny little store that is completely packed full of stuff. The price for candy and nuts is extremely reasonable so of course there are always people waiting. The ladies wiring the counter are nice and helpful. They even offered to take some pictures of us. The only bad part is having to decide between all the goodies. 
Oh yeah, and everything was fresh. I was surprised considering how much candy they have.

data.title: NOSTALGIC SHOPPE -  LOVE IT !!!!!!!
data.text: This place is Great!! It is a step back to childhood. A lot of old candy favorites and a large selection of nuts.  It is decorated with some old antiques and a Mr. Peanut from way back.You have stop in and take some goodies home !!!

data.title: I love this place
data.text: This place has been around for years.  I visit at least twice a year ... fresh warm pecans!  A must visit in Akron!

data.title: Trolley Stop
data.text: We make this a stop when we catch the free Lolly the trolley ride on Fridays or attend an event at the civic. They sell candy and nuts by the quarter pound. The kids feel so special picking out their favorites.

data.title: Yumm
data.text: Took my prego wife there. She just about bought some of everything in there.  Super nice staff, free samples.  Ice cream was great.  Fun stop!

data.title: Small but might
data.text: The street was closed due to a festival set up so we had difficulty finding it.  Luckily an UPS driver gave us directions!  The store is S.M.A.L.L.  Over a dozen different nuts, prices reasonable.  Also had about the same amount of candy.  Unique store, wooden floors, scales use weighted rings for counterbalance!  Fun to see.  Not sure I would go way out of my way to come.

data.title: Best chocolate toffee ever
data.text: I am a frequent customer and visit at least once a month. I get the peanut candy (sugar-glazed peanuts cut into bite-sized blocks) every time. But one day I discovered their chocolate toffee and, oh my goodness, is it ever good! It's cooked just right so it's brittle when you bite into but not chewy. And it's buttery with just the right amount of saltiness to balance the wonderful, silky milk chocolate, so it's not too sweet. Oh, did I mention the pecans on top? It is the best toffee I have tasted, bar none. So now when I make my visits I get the peanut candy AND the toffee! TIP: they do take credit cards but only for purchases of $5 or more. An they're closed on Sunday's. Bon appetit!

data.title: The Peanut Shoppe
data.text: This shop has given me so many fond memories!  It was our first stop on the way to the movies!  There's quite a variety to choose from.  Stop in and check out this great nut shop!!  It'll make your day!

data.title: Good old fashion "Peanut Shop"
data.text: This Peanut Shop is as much Akron as is Firestone Rubber! That's what my husband always said. And its so true. Its a fun old time peanut shop with quite a display of different kinds of peanuts. Its a bit of The way it used to be"! Fun and yummy!

data.title: A local jem
data.text: I've been going to this place as long as I remember and the quality hasn't changed a bit! The smell alone can make your mouth water and they have the freshest cashews! My ultimate favorite will always be the milk chocolate covered raisins.

data.title: Akron's Peanut Shoppe - Not To Be Missed
data.text: Akron's venerable Peanut Shoppe is an Akron institution that shouldn't be missed by anyone - native or traveler alike - making downtown Akron its home, in one place or another along South Main Street, for move than eight decades. Peanuts, of course, and Mr. Peanut's there, too, but also a delectable variety of nuts, dried fruit, granola, candy, chips and whatnot, as well as - in season - Akron's most delicious frozen yogurts. What's not to like?

data.title: Peanut Shoppe and Akron Tradition
data.text: What can you say? This is the Peanut Shoppe!! They are a small funky little place across from Lock 3 Park. They have an amazing selection of nuts, nut butters, chocolates, caramels, and other candies. Everything is sold by weight. Going to the game at Canal Park? Stop in to stock up.

data.title: So glad I found this place!
data.text: Waiting to meet a friend at a nearby restaurant I decided to check this place out.  What a neat place!!!   The trail mix is fantastic.  Staff was very friendly and prices are reasonable!

data.title: A walk back in time!
data.text: The peanut shop is unlike anywhere I've ever been.  It's been a downtown staple for decades. There's tons of candy and nut selections.  You choose how much of the item you want, and the employee weighs out the amount on a (historical) scale and then gives you the item in a small paper bag.  I must stop while in downtown Akron!!

data.title: Love the Peanut Shoppe
data.text: So much to choose from at the Peanut Shoppe. Margie is wonderful.  I always find new candies and peanuts at her shop.

data.title: STEP BACK TO YOUR CHILDHOOD!!
data.text: Well, if you were born in the 50's anyways!!  This place is really a step back in time and is just a fun place to go.  And what is extra special, is that the people who work there are just so nice!!  The nuts are always super fresh and there are alot of candy choices (although I am more into the nuts)  They even give you your goodies in the the little white paper bags from the old days and you can buy the smallest of amounts all measured out on the old hand weights.

data.title: Best fresh Redskin Peanuts and Peanut Butter.
data.text: I have been a customer of The Peanut Shoppe since the 1950's when my parents would take me downtown Akron for a day of shopping and lunch.  We would always stop by the Peanut Shoppe to get fresh roasted peanuts - it doesn't get any better than this.  Through the years we have patronized this establishment and the product is of excellent quality.  You may also enjoy the memorabilia they have on display. Well worth a trip downtown Akron.
